alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 12:47AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Tammany and southeastern Washington Parishes, northwestern Harrison, northern Hancock and central Pearl River Counties through 130 AM CST... At 1246 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bush to 13 miles southwest of Madisonville. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Picayune, Covington, Pearl River, Abita Springs, Madisonville, Sun, Lacombe, Crossroads, Stennis Space Center, Bush, Mcneil and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 259 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 12 between mile markers 61 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.
